intro: Taeniophyllum usneoides, commonly known as the beard moss, is a species of liverwort that belongs to the family Parietariaceae. It is a small, carpet-like plant that typically grows on rocks, tree bark, or soil surfaces in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a distinctive appearance with dense, thread-like structures that resemble a beard, hence its common name. It lacks true roots and instead absorbs water and nutrients through its leaf-like structures. Taeniophyllum usneoides is often found in temperate and tropical regions, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
